revisions.rev:
{{Geobox|Range | name=Orvin Mountains | native_name=Orvinfjella | image=Conrad Mountains North.jpg | image_caption=View looking to the west over [[Glopeken glacier]]. Glopeken glacier is located in the northern part of the [[Conrad Mountains]], a subrange of the Orvin Mountains. | image_flag= | map=Antarctica,_Norway_territorial_claim.svg | map_caption=Map depicting the territorial extent of Queen Maud Land | region=[[Queen Maud Land]], [[East Antarctica]] | region_type = | country=Antarctica | country_type=Continent | country_flag=true | parent=[[East Antarctica Ranges]] | border= | geology= | period= | orogeny= | highest=[[Sandeggtind Peak]] | highest_elevation_imperial=10023 | highest_lat_d=72|highest_lat_m=00|highest_lat_s=00|highest_lat_NS=S | highest_long_d=09|highest_long_m=00|highest_long_s=00|highest_long_EW=E }} The '''Orvin Mountains''' ({{lang-no|'''Orvinfjella'''}}) constitute a major group of [[mountain range]]s, extending for about 65 miles between the [[Wohlthat Mountains]] and the [[MÃ¼hlig-Hofmann Mountains]] in [[Queen Maud Land]]. With its [[Summit (topography)|summit]] at {{convert|3055|m|ft|0}}, the massive [[Sandeggtind Peak]] forms the highest point in the [[Conrad Mountains]], a subrange of the Orvin Mountains.
==Discovery and naming== {{Location map|Antarctica|lat_deg=71|lat_min=50|lat_dir=S|lon_deg=09|lon_min=40|lon_dir=E|float=left|mark=Fire.svg|marksize=12|AlternativeMap=Antarctica relief location map.jpg|label=Orvin Mountains|position=top|caption=Map depicting the location of the Orvin Mountains in [[Queen Maud Land]], [[Antarctica]]}}
First photographed from the air and roughly plotted by the [[Third German Antarctic Expedition]] (1938-1939), led by Capt. [[Alfred Ritscher]]. Mapped by Norwegian cartographers from surveys and air photos by the [[Sixth Norwegian Antarctic Expedition]] (1956-60) and named for [[Anders K. Orvin]], director of the [[Norwegian Polar Institute]] from 1958 to 1959.<ref>{{cite gnis| type = antarid| id = 11171| name = Orvin Mountains| accessdate = 31 May 2010}}</ref>
==Constituent ranges== Constituent ranges of Orvin Mountains, listed from east to west: * [[Shcherbakov Range]] * [[Mount Dallmann]] * [[Conrad Mountains]] * [[Gagarin Mountains]] * [[Kurze Mountains]] * [[Drygalski Mountains]] * [[Filchner Mountains]]
==See also== * [[List of Antarctic expeditions]] * [[East Antarctica Ranges]] * [[East Antarctic two-thousanders]]
